name: Labor
description: Participants shall uphold fair labor practices, ensuring voluntary work, fair wages, reasonable hours, non-discrimination, and freedom of association, in compliance with the RBA Code of Conduct.

subCriterion.name: Prohibition of Forced Labor
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure that all work is voluntary, prohibiting forced, bonded, or involuntary prison labor, and ensuring workers are not required to pay fees or surrender identity documents.

subCriterion.name: Young workers
subCriterion.description: Participants shall not employ workers under the age of 15, except as permitted by law, and ensure young workers (15–18) are protected from hazardous work.

subCriterion.name: Working Hours
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure working hours do not exceed legal limits, with a maximum of 60 hours per week (including overtime) except in emergencies, and provide at least one day off per seven-day period.

subCriterion.name: Wages and Benefits
subCriterion.description: Participants shall pay workers at least the minimum wage, provide legally mandated benefits, and ensure timely and transparent wage payments.

subCriterion.name: Non-Discrimination / Non-Harassment / Humane Treatment
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure workplaces are free from discrimination, harassment, and inhumane treatment, promoting equality and respect.

subCriterion.name: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
subCriterion.description: Participants shall respect workers’ rights to form and join trade unions and engage in collective bargaining, without interference or retaliation.

subCriterion.name: Labor Management System
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement a management system to ensure compliance with labor standards, including policies, training, and continuous improvement.

name: Health and Safety
description: Participants shall provide a safe and healthy workplace, implementing measures to prevent injuries, illnesses, and emergencies, and ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.

subCriterion.name: Occupational Health and Safety
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure a safe and healthy work environment, identifying and controlling workplace hazards through risk assessments and appropriate controls.

subCriterion.name: Emergency Preparedness
subCriterion.description: Participants shall develop and maintain emergency preparedness plans to address potential workplace emergencies, including evacuation procedures and drills.

subCriterion.name: Occupational Injury and Illness
subCriterion.description: Participants shall establish procedures to prevent, manage, and address occupational injuries and illnesses, ensuring proper reporting and follow-up.

subCriterion.name: Industrial Hygiene
subCriterion.description: Participants shall protect workers from exposure to chemical, biological, and physical agents through monitoring and control measures.

subCriterion.name: Physically Demanding Work
subCriterion.description: Participants shall identify and mitigate risks associated with physically demanding tasks to protect worker health.

subCriterion.name: Machine safeguarding
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure machinery is properly guarded and maintained to prevent worker injuries.

subCriterion.name: Food, Saniation and Housing
subCriterion.description: Participants shall provide clean and safe food, sanitation, and housing facilities for workers, where applicable.

subCriterion.name: Health and Safety Management System
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement a management system to ensure compliance with health and safety standards, including risk management and continuous improvement.

name: Environment
description: Participants shall minimize environmental impact through compliance with regulations, effective management of resources, and reduction of emissions and waste.

subCriterion.name: Environmental Permits and Reporting
subCriterion.description: Participants shall obtain, maintain, and keep current all required environmental permits and comply with reporting requirements.

subCriterion.name: Hazardous Substances
subCriterion.description: Participants shall identify, manage, and safely handle hazardous substances to prevent environmental and health risks.

subCriterion.name: Solid Waste
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement programs to minimize solid waste generation and ensure proper disposal or recycling.

subCriterion.name: Air Emissions
subCriterion.description: Participants shall monitor and control air emissions to minimize environmental impact and comply with regulations.

subCriterion.name: Water Management
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement programs to conserve water and prevent water pollution through effective management practices.

subCriterion.name: Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions
subCriterion.description: Participants shall track and reduce energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions to minimize environmental impact.

subCriterion.name: Environmental Management Systems
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement an environmental management system to ensure compliance with environmental standards and drive continuous improvement.

name: Ethics
description: Participants shall uphold the highest standards of business integrity, ensuring transparency, fairness, and protection of stakeholder rights in all operations.

subCriterion.name: Business Integrity and No Improper Advantage
subCriterion.description: Participants shall maintain the highest standards of integrity, prohibiting bribery, corruption, or improper advantages in business dealings.

subCriterion.name: Disclosure of Information
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure accurate and timely disclosure of business information, maintaining transparency with stakeholders.

subCriterion.name: Intellectual Property
subCriterion.description: Participants shall respect intellectual property rights and implement safeguards to protect proprietary information.

subCriterion.name: Fair Business, Advertising and Competition
subCriterion.description: Participants shall conduct business fairly, adhering to fair advertising and competition laws.

subCriterion.name: Protection of Identity and Non-Retaliation
subCriterion.description: Participants shall protect the identity of whistleblowers and ensure no retaliation for reporting concerns.

subCriterion.name: Privacy
subCriterion.description: Participants shall protect personal and sensitive information of workers and stakeholders, complying with privacy laws.

subCriterion.name: Ethics Management System
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement an ethics management system to ensure compliance with ethical standards and promote integrity.

name: Suppy Chain Management
description: Participants shall ensure responsible supply chain practices, including compliance with RBA standards, responsible sourcing, and supplier accountability.

subCriterion.name: Company Commitment
subCriterion.description: Participants shall adopt and communicate a Code of Conduct aligned with RBA requirements, ensuring senior management support and compliance with laws.

subCriterion.name: Materials Restrictions
subCriterion.description: Participants shall comply with material restrictions, including restrictions on hazardous substances in products and manufacturing processes.

subCriterion.name: Responsible Sourcing of Minerals
subCriterion.description: Participants shall implement due diligence to ensure minerals are sourced responsibly, avoiding conflict-affected and high-risk areas.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Responsibility
subCriterion.description: Participants shall ensure suppliers comply with RBA standards through risk assessments, audits, and corrective actions.
